intro: Erigeron depilis, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron depilis is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid conditions with its hairy, drought-resistant foliage.
